keyTakeAways: Terrassa, a town in Catalonia, Spain, has temporarily banned the adoption of black cats during the Halloween season to prevent potential harmful or macabre rituals.
The ban, implemented by the local animal welfare service, is considered temporary and exceptional, driven by concerns over cultural superstitions linking black cats to witchcraft.
While black cats are often associated with bad luck in Western traditions, other cultures view them positively as symbols of prosperity.
The city council has noted no incidents of cruelty in Terrassa but acknowledges similar cases elsewhere, prompting precautionary action.
The adoption center in Terrassa houses around 100 cats, including 12 black ones, and the ban applies to all fostering or adoption requests for black cats during the period.
Exceptions to the ban will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, and normal adoption practices will resume after the Halloween period.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Terrassa, a town in Catalonia, Spain, has implemented a temporary ban on the adoption of black cats from animal shelters from 6 October to 10 November 2025 to protect them from potential ritualistic harm during Halloween. Deputy Mayor Noel Duque explained that adoption requests for black cats typically spike during the holiday season due to cultural superstitions linking black cats to witchcraft. While black cats are viewed positively in some cultures like Japan and Egypt, the local animal welfare service took precautionary action after receiving warnings from animal welfare groups about past incidents of cruelty. The ban is temporary and will be reviewed for future application, with exceptions assessed individually and normal adoption resuming after the Halloween period.
title: Terrassa: Catalonian town bans black cat adoptions during Halloween
